xxl.core.math.statistics.nonparametric.kernels
Class ReflectionKernelCDF

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.functions.AbstractFunction<java.lang.Number,java.lang.Double>
      xxl.core.math.functions.AbstractRealFunctionFunction
          xxl.core.math.statistics.nonparametric.kernels.AbstractKernelCDF
              xxl.core.math.statistics.nonparametric.kernels.ReflectionKernelCDF
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, Function<java.lang.Number,java.lang.Double>, RealFunction, WindowQuery
public class ReflectionKernelCDF
extends AbstractKernelCDF

This class implements an abstract preimplementation of a kernel based cdf estimator AbstractKernelCDF that uses reflection for avoiding boundary effects. Additionally, this class provides a FACTORY for generating reflection kernel based cdf estimators.

See Also:
KernelFunction, KernelBandwidths, AbstractRealFunctionFunction, AbstractKernelCDF, NativeKernelCDF, Serialized Form

Field Detail

FACTORY

public static Function FACTORY
Provides a factory for a reflection based kernel distribution estimator , i.e., an estimator using reflection for boundary treatment. The parameters needed for construction are passed to the factory by an Object[] o containing:
o[0]: used kernel function
o[1]: used sample as Object[] containing numerical data
o[2]: used bandwidth as Object of type Number
o[3]: minimum of the data space as Object of type Number
o[4]: maximum of the data space as Object of type Number

min

protected double min
left border of the range supported by the estimator

max

protected double max
right border of the range supported by the estimator

Constructor Detail

ReflectionKernelCDF

public ReflectionKernelCDF(KernelFunction kf,
                           java.lang.Object[] sample,
                           double h,
                           double min,
                           double max)
                    throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Constructs a new kernel based cdf estimator.

Parameters:
kf - used Kernel function with restricted support [-1,1]
sample - sample of a data set given as Object[] containing objects of type Number.
h - used bandwidth for computing the estimation
min - left border of the range supported by the estimator
max - right border of the range supported by the estimator
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if a kernel function without restricted support to [-1,1] is given or a kernel function is given that doesn't implement the interface Integrable

Flip the given x value at the given y-axis (x coordinate of the x-Axis).

Parameters:

Returns:
